posts.post_content:
A friend pointed out the benefit with Kaalia. I stared at it for a minute and realized that since The Balrog isn't in play during the declare attackers step, the effect of you having to sacrifce when he comes into play attacking doesn't happen.
  
   
He's a great one shotter like that, and if used as a focal point in a deck focused around demons, if you thrown in [blood speaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=blood speaker), and [rune-scarred demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rune-scarred demon), fun times for you.
posts.html:
A friend pointed out the benefit with Kaalia. I stared at it for a minute and realized that since The Balrog isn't in play during the declare attackers step, the effect of you having to sacrifce when he comes into play attacking doesn't happen.

He's a great one shotter like that, and if used as a focal point in a deck focused around demons, if you thrown in blood speaker, and rune-scarred demon, fun times for you.

Posted By: Zaskist (9/12/2012 10:38:25 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Nagrus: In Magic, "attacks" mean exactly one thing: "be declared as an attacker in the Decalre Attackers step". With Kaalia, Rakdos is never declared as an attacker but rather enters the battlefield attacking, so this ability does not trigger.  
The fact that you don't understand the rules doesn't mean that people who do are cheating. Seriously, read the Comprehensive Rules before you make statements like that. Asking questions is perfectly fine, but accusing people to change the rules for their own convenience is not.
posts.html:
@Nagrus: In Magic, "attacks" mean exactly one thing: "be declared as an attacker in the Decalre Attackers step". With Kaalia, Rakdos is never declared as an attacker but rather enters the battlefield attacking, so this ability does not trigger.
The fact that you don't understand the rules doesn't mean that people who do are cheating. Seriously, read the Comprehensive Rules before you make statements like that. Asking questions is perfectly fine, but accusing people to change the rules for their own convenience is not.

Posted By: Subbak (11/13/2012 8:10:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Oni Possession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oni Possession) is a must for all the Kaalia fans out there looking at this card.   
  
With enough Black and White, and multi-Black/Red cards in your deck (remember- death triggers! :), you really don't need to be all that sad about your Angels and Dragons dying (I wouldn't go with All Demons, some cards are just too good to pass up- particularly [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) and Akroma) because you'll be able to Reanimate them out with some kind of Living Death effect anyway-  
  
HOWEVER. You really don't want to be caught sacrificing [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia) herself. Thanks to [Aurelia, the Warbringer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aurelia, the Warbringer) you might find yourself in the midgame actually not minding at all the idea of sacrificing Sol Ring or your Signets, because your cards are just a little stupid good together. :3 But Kaalia of the Vast is a non-Demon permanent, and a forced sacrifice is something no [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) or [Sword of War and Peace/a](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of War and Peace/a)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
....Seriously? No one has mentioned [It that Betrays](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=It that Betrays)? Yes, I will take half your permanents, thank you!  
  
Also, if you have a way to make infinite tokens, you can swing and sac nothing. You have infinite tokens, therefore infinite permanents. You sac half of infinity, or infinity permanents. So sac infinity tokens, which leaves you with infinity tokens and all of your non-token permanents. Infinity is a weird concept.
posts.html:
....Seriously? No one has mentioned It that Betrays? Yes, I will take half your permanents, thank you!

Also, if you have a way to make infinite tokens, you can swing and sac nothing. You have infinite tokens, therefore infinite permanents. You sac half of infinity, or infinity permanents. So sac infinity tokens, which leaves you with infinity tokens and all of your non-token permanents. Infinity is a weird concept.
